instructions.title: Info and Help
instructions.short_description: A project that seeks to democratize and complement investigative journalism and fact-checking.
instructions.description: It is based on millions of news of the main generalist Portuguese newspapers, written in the past 20 years, and that are preserved on the portuguese web archive (arquivo.pt).

search.title: Search
search.content: Use the search box on the left to look for people, organizations , places or even other entities. When you select the entity, it will appear on the explorer.

expand.title: Expand
expand.content:
With an entity in the explorer, you can use any of the following ways to expand it:
  • double click on the entity
  • right click on the node followed by expand in the menu
  • in the section Other actions on the lower left
When the expansion happens we apply the limits on the number of entities to show and the type of entities, according to the selected values.
If you repeat any of the above three actions on a node, this will return to its initial non-expanded state, and the now loose entities will be removed.

filter.title: Filter
filter.content:
You can filter both the visible nodes in the explorer as well as those that will appear along the way, in two different ways:
  • choosing only some of the four types of entities available
  • hiding nodes based on the weight of the links currently in the explorer:
    • the weight of a link between two entities corresponds to the number of news where they co-occur
    • when expanding a node, the links are not automatically hidden but will be once this filter is changed

investigate.title: Investigate
investigate.content: Apart from the countless possibilities that search, expansion and filtering allow, it is still possible to
investigate.item0: identify, among existing relationships, which are common to the selected entities
investigate.item1: check if there is a link between any two entities
investigate.item2: search common relationships common to two entites

visualize.title: Visualize
visualize.content:
In the Node arrangement section, you can try out different types of graph visualization.
Additionally, you can interact with the explorer
  • by dragging (the nodes or the canvas)
  • zooming in and out
  • right clicking on a node or link to see a menu with more options, where you can:
    • highlight nodes
    • select nodes and links
    • select the links of a given node
    • remove nodes and links

news.title: News
news.content:
If the news search is active (use the toggle button on the top right corner), every time you select
  • a node: you will see the news in which the respective node appears
  • a link:you will see the news where both entities that form the link appear
In turn, the news on the right side show the title, part of the content as well as the complete set of entities appearing in it (clicking one will place it in the canvas/explorer), as well as a url to the originally preserved page on arquivo.pt.

shortcuts.title: Keyboard shortcuts
shortcuts.content:
In order to increase productivity, the following keyboard shortcuts are available:
  • ctrl+f activates the entitiy search box
  • ctrl+a selects all nodes in the explorer
  • del removes the selected nodes
  • esc clears selected nodes and links
  • n toggles the automatic news search when clicking a node or link

expansion_about.title: About
expansion_about.question: What?
expansion_about.content:
Desarquivo is designed as a reproducible effort based on a set of configurations from which we highlight

  • The first investigated entities, the ones that lead to the subsequent network expansion. In this version, these are José Sócrates (ex prime-minister of Portugal) and Isabel dos Santos (from Luanda Leaks)
  • The period of time to include in the current version, which is between the year 2000 and 2020
  • The newspapers to search - in this version: Público, Expresso, Diário de Notícias, Correio da Manhã, Sol, Visão and Jornal de Notícias
The collected news were analysed and the entities they mentioned were identified (people, organizations, places, and others) along with their links. These links form an immense network which is now exploitable in this graphical interface, or directly in the open sourced raw data.
Desarquivo rests on two databases, namely MongoDB (NoSQL) and neo4j (Graphs).

expansion_context.title: Context
expansion_context.question: When?
expansion_context.content: Although idealized previously, it is worth mentioning that the first public version of this project was entirely developed during the state of emergency declared in Portugal, due to the covid-19 pandemic, early in 2020.
